Please answer TRUE, FALSE or UNKNOWABLE about the text's veracity. In addition write a short summary explaining your answer. If the veracity cannot be determined answer UNKNOWABLE. The first sentence in the response should be TRUE. FALSE. or UNKNOWABLE. eg:UNKNOWABLE.

Determine whether the statement is TRUE or FALSE based on the content and a number of short explanations with additional information. Only one of the following explanations is relevant: SECTION A:

Two parliamentary proposals dealing with the definition of marriage were recently submitted to the Chamber of Deputies. According to the first proposal (.pdf), which was sent to deputies on June 13, the Civil Code and related regulations should be amended, and the definition of marriage contained therein as a union between a man and a woman should be changed to a union between two people.

The proposal to equalize same-sex unions was submitted by a group of deputies from ANO, Pirates, ČSSD, TOP 09, KSČM and STAN. The Pirates club was the most united in this case, with seventeen out of the total twenty-two deputies submitting the bill.

Two days later, another proposal (.pdf) was sent to the deputies, according to which the Charter of Fundamental Rights and Freedoms should be amended, where Article 32 would be supplemented with an explicit definition of marriage as a union between a man and a woman. Currently, the first sentence of Article 32 protects parenthood and the family; if the amendment to the Charter is approved, parenthood, family and marriage as a union between a man and a woman would be protected.

The proposal to amend the Charter of Fundamental Rights and Freedoms was submitted by a group of deputies from the parliamentary groups ANO, KDU-ČSL, ODS, ČSSD, TOP 09 and STAN. Apart from the KDU-ČSL club, where all ten deputies submitted the proposal, the other parliamentary groups were by no means united.

From the table we can see that the deputies (with the exception of the KDU-ČSL club and to some extent the Pirates) do not really decide according to the party program, but very freely according to their own discretion. Thus, in several parliamentary clubs there are both streams of opinion, i.e. deputies who support equal rights for same-sex unions and those who, on the contrary, want to protect marriage as a union between a man and a woman by constitutional order.

In the last election period, a proposal (.pdf) to amend the Registered Partnership Act was submitted to the Chamber of Deputies, which would allow registered partners to adopt the child of the other partner, thus ensuring the child's equal legal relationship to both partners. This proposal was also submitted by a very diverse group of MPs from six parliamentary groups (all except the KDU-ČSL group), but it was not voted on.

SECTION B:

Jiří Pospíšil stated in an interview for Czech Radio that if Andrej Babiš proceeds in this way, he should offer the Italian government another form of assistance. Although he did not directly criticize his actions, he did not express direct approval either. That he would directly defend Babiš is indeed an abbreviation that was published by Parlamentní listy in its text.

The chairman of TOP 09 commented on Andrej Babiš's response to the Italian government's refusal to accept some refugees (video, 7:12) on Radiožurnál's 20 minut program. However, he did not directly agree with the prime minister's decision, only stating that it would be good to offer Italy other assistance in such a case and not close ourselves off from further communication.

"I personally think that at a time when the Czech Republic and, in principle, the entire political representation rejects mandatory quotas, the redistribution of refugees against their will across Europe, it would be reasonable to offer the Italian side some other form of assistance than accepting refugees who are not going to the Czech Republic themselves and have not applied for asylum in the Czech Republic. I am convinced that we should grant asylum to those who apply for asylum in the Czech Republic and meet the conditions of Czech legislation and Czech laws."

His response was distorted by Parlamentní listy, which incorrectly reported Jiří Pospíšil's agreement with Andrej Babiš in the headline of the article: " Top 09 boss Pospíšil stood up for Babiš on the issue of accepting refugees. Really." Therefore, we assess the statement as true.

Miroslav Kalousek and Karel Schwarzenberg criticized Jiří Pospíšil's alleged statement as inconsistent with TOP09's current policy. Miroslav Kalousek did so on his Twitter account, where he stated that he respects his chairman, but cannot agree with his opinion.

Karel Schwarzenberg also made a similar statement on his Facebook page: "The government's attitude towards the Italian Prime Minister's request is, firstly, stupid, secondly, inhumane, and thirdly, contrary to our principles, which are based on our Judeo-Christian spiritual heritage." He also spoke in a similar vein in an interview with Hospodářské noviny.





















Respond only with either TRUE or FALSE and the correct section name, examples: TRUE, SECTION A.
